comments.creator: jithin1987@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

At gmail.com cmd + click always opens links in a mail on foreground. It happens only in firefox.

Reproducible: Always


Actual Results:  
Cmd + clicking on links inside a mail is opening it on foreground.

Expected Results:  
Cmd + clicking should open links on background always.
comments.author: jithin1987@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.text: Go to Options>tabs, and see if "When I open a link in a new tab, switch to it immediately" is checked or not
comments.raw_text: Go to Options>tabs, and see if "When I open a link in a new tab, switch to it immediately" is checked or not

comments.author: jithin1987@gmail.com
comments.text: Its unchecked and this is happening only on gmail.
comments.raw_text: Its unchecked and this is happening only on gmail.
comments.creator: jithin1987@gmail.com

comments.text:
Reproducible for me on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110606 Firefox/7.0a1

The options "When I open a link in a new tab, switch to it immediately" is unchecked.
comments.author: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.creator: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Reproducible for me on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110606 Firefox/7.0a1

The options "When I open a link in a new tab, switch to it immediately" is unchecked.
This is still happens on firefox 8. And firefox is the only browser with this behavior. Opera and chrome works as expected.
comments.creator: jithin1987@gmail.com
comments.text: This is still happens on firefox 8. And firefox is the only browser with this behavior. Opera and chrome works as expected.
comments.author: jithin1987@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: This is still happening for me. I'm in the process of seeing if I'll move back to FF after many years away and this behavior is inconsistent with every other browser I use. Is it possible for someone to investigate?
comments.text: This is still happening for me. I'm in the process of seeing if I'll move back to FF after many years away and this behavior is inconsistent with every other browser I use. Is it possible for someone to investigate?
